Consumer Watchdog, a group which has been highly critical of Google's privacy practices, condemned the agreement to settle the issue through negotiations and called for congressional hearings on the subject. The details of the biggest privacy breach in history shouldn't be settled in secret, said John Simpson of Consumer Watchdog.`` This makes it clear why Google CEO Eric Schmidt needs to testify under oath before Congress about Wi-Spy.''
